cell.p:
This Company's system of submarine telegraph
cables is the most direct and quickest means of
communication from Egypt to Europe, North and
South America, East, South and West Africa,
India, Australia, New Zealand, China and Japan.

To secure quick transmission, telegrams should
be marked Via Eastern.

For latest average time to London, see daily
bulletin in this paper.

STATIONS IN EGYPT: Alexandria, Cairo,
Suez, Port-Tewfik, Port-Saïd, Suakin. Head
Office. London.

BREMEN, HAMBURG, AMERICA,
EASTERN ASIA, AUSTRALIA Etc.

undertakes every description of banking busines
Current accounts opened with commercial ha ises
and private individuals in conformity with th-ND AT BIRMINGHAM & MANOHESTER

Fixed deposits for one year certain received at à per cent per annum. Depo-its at interest for shorter periods are also received at mates to be agreed upon. Letters of Credis for the use of travellers are isted payable in al parte of the World. Approved hills discounted.
Bille, documentary invoices, eto, collected. Deaf and singapoio transfers inued pay- able all over the World.
Foreign exchange bought and sold. Advsners made upon approved securities and upon cotton, cotton-seed, sugar and other mer abandies.
The parchaee and sale of stocks and shares on the London Stock Exchange and on the loesl and Continental Bourses, undertaken.

Customers osa deposit their valuables, bonds, , for le enstody in the Bank's fire-proof strong-rooms, and the Bank will attend to the collecuen of the coupons and drawn bonds deposited as they fall due
Annaides, pensions, dividends, eto, collected. All farther particulars and information can be oblained on application.
The officers and olerke, of the Bank are pledged to secrecy as to the tran- sactions of customers.

The George Nungovich Hotels.
Grand Hotel, Heleuan.-Finest and most luxurious Hotel near Cairo. Patunised by Royalty. Moderate charges. Special terms for resident Hotel des Bains-Most comfortable hotel, opposite the Baths. Pension from P.T. 4. Attached to the above hotels and specially roved for their clients are the Golf Links (18 holes) with English Professional. Own Golf House in the desert. Sulphur Bath Establishment-Sulphur water stronger than any in Europe. Eight European Masseurs and ose Every modern sprovement.
THE WORLD'S MEDICINE.
BEECHAM'S PILLS
Care all Billous and Nervous Disorders, Sick Headache, Constipation, Impaired Digestion, Wind and Pains in Stomach, Disordered Liver and Female Allments. They act like Magie on the Vital Organs, Regulating the Secretions, restoring the long-lost Complexion, bringing back the keen edge of Appetite, and arousing with the Rosebud of Health the whole physical energy of the human frame..
BEECHAM'S PILLS are the most popular English family Medicine, and are composed entirely of Medicinal Herbs. They cleanse the stomach, and bowels, purify the blood, invigorate the nervous system, and give tone and energy to the Muscles. BEECHAM'S PILLS have the largest sale of any Medicine in the World.
Sold at all Drug Stores In Egypt, is boxes, 4 plastres and 6 plastres.

ST. PETERSBURG, November 21. As a result of Prince Mirskis appointment the Government gave permission for a public ST. PETERSBURG, November 21. from the Zemstvos throughout the country, but conference to be held here of representatives General Kuropatkin reports that, during at the last moment deslined to sanction the the night of the 16th inst., four volunteers with same, though allowing the delegates to meet pyroxyline bombs blew up a Chinese building privately. The Government forbade the news on the Russian left, which was occupied by 25 papers to mention the matter. The delegates Japanese. The latter were all killed or wounded, met last Saturday privately, and adopted and were buried in the debris. With this radical resolutions demanding a constitution, exception, all is quiet in Manchuria. (Reuter.) an elective legislative assembly, together with liberty of conscience, press, speech, and educa (Reuter.)
The Khedive is still on his estates at Mon- tazah.
His Highness has been graciously pleased to bestow the following ranks on the under mentioned officials:
Sanich Nicolas Sawaya Bey, ex-postmaster of Tantah.
Salissah Salib Nakhla Effendi, ex-chief accountant of the province of Sharkieh, and Iskandar Khalil Effendi, ex-station-master at Suez

Port Said, Sunday-It is now understood that the Baltic Fleet will reach Port Said on Wednesday next at dawn. The Fleet, which is under the command of Vice Admiral Volker Penne have left Naples on a trip to Egypt sahm, will number 20 vessels, comprising 2 of the Volunteer Fleet, and 4 German colliers Controller-General of the Port battleships, 2 cruisers, 7 destroyers, 5 steamers Bose Admiral Sir Matie supply of coal, water, and provisions, suficient yesterday from Cairo. to carry them to the next port of call. A. L. M. & D. S.-The next practice of the choral union of the A.L.M. & D.S. will take place at Kudolph's Asile on Friday at 6.30 p.m. BRITISH RECREATION CLUB, CAIRO.-Parents who have not already done so are kindly asked to send in names and ages of their children.
THE PILGRIMAGE-Dr. Hayes, of the Qua- rantine Service, has arrived at Alexandria from Suez on important duty connected with the forthcoming pilgrimage.
stalls in the. Zazinis Theatre for the coming OPERA SEASON.-The drawing for boxes and operatic season will take place at the Khe- divial Bourse st 6.15 p.m. to-day.

HEDJAZ RAILWAY. Marshal Kiazim Pasha, director of the works of the Hedjar Railway, has telegraphically communicated to the High Commission for that line a summary of the contents of the chief engineer's report on the work done during this report, the work is making good progress the past month, beyond Maan. According to both as regards the earthworks and the build- ing of bridges and tunnels. The boring of tunnels Nos. 1 and 5 is very shortly to be taken in hand. Tunnel No. 2 has been bored, No. 3 has been commenced, No. 4 is practically finished, and No. 6 is completely finished.

As soon as the vessels were signalled the Greek colony made holiday, and assembled in thousands on the breakwater and along the Quai François Joseph, to welcome their com patriots. Several crowded launches, on the largest of which (the Ibis) was the reception committee and a band playing national airs, went out to meet the ships and accompanied usual official calls were paid. them to their moorings Shortly after, the
Greek flags and decorations are in evidence

circulated by mischiet-makers from time to time, respecting a probable attack upon the Russian Fleet in Egyptian waters by the Japanese or their emissaries, such having not the slightest foundation in fact.

official sources fixed the arrival of the fleet for Port Said, Monday. On Sunday, last even the following Monday. A space on the Asiatic side of the canal was cleared of all shipping, so that the nerves of the fleet might not be un- everywhere, Port-Said possessing a large or other formidable craft. Special pilots duly strained by the presence of felucas, barges, Greek community. were also warned for duty. It is now reported that the Russian Consal has advised the Canal Company officials that the fleet will not arrive until Saturday next. It has struck more than one, that it is a good deal safer for this fleet, composed as it is of old ships (barring the dan troyers) to await the arrival in the Indian Ocean of the main fleet before venturing past Aden alone.
The Hellenie Minister of Finance has sent 50,000 tickets to Egypt for the Greek Fleet Lottery. It is believed that more than 100,000 tickets will be taken in Egypt

Chitty Bey, Director-General of Customs on business connected with his Administration, left Alexandria yesterday afternoon for Cairo,
Drs. Ward R. F. Campbell and Takvorian Arshag have been authorised to exercise their profession in Egypt.

some of the officers and men of the Baltic Fleet have roamed the streets of the town in a state of wild.intoxication, insulting and assaulting the inhabitants. During the drunken brawls, they murdered at least five persons. Forty Russians have-deserted.
OUTRAGE ON HUNGARIAN PREMIER, ASSAILED WITH SNOWBALLS.

The Ellerman 8.8. Ararat sailed from Malta on Monday, and is due here with passengers mails, and general cargo on Friday morning. The Khedivial Mail 8. 8. Prince Abbas will leave Alexandria on Wednesday, for Pir Smyrna, Mitylene, and Constantinople..
